item.title: About
item.description:
I am a Junior Undergraduate in IIT Kanpur. I am pursuing Bachelors of Technology in Electrical Engineering with a minor in Computer Science, specifically, Artificial Intelligence. I am broadly interested in Machine Learning and its applications in Computer Vision. I regularly take part in competitive programming contests. Currently, I am working on the MovieQA problem with Dr. Vinay Namboodiri.

I hail from the holy city of Amritsar, Punjab. Just like many other math oriented students in India, I decided to give the “JEE” in 2014. I did decently well, securing AIR 376 after two years of toil, which landed me in Electrical Engineering at IIT Kanpur.

Freshmen year was my first formal tryst with programming, which I have been hooked to ever since. I started competitive programming shortly after. I recently qualified for ACM ICPC Regionals in Amritapuri and Chennai, securing 63 rank in the online qualification round.

In Summer of 2016, I got to intern in Texas A&M University, supervised by Dr. Srinivas Shakkottai. We worked on analyzing the privacy of a user in a DSRC environment, which enables vehicle to vehicle/infrastructure communication, using a combination of analytical and machine learning tools.

For more details pertaining to my academics and projects, please refer to my CV.
